greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct prime factors of n^2-1.
comment: This is a very slowly growing sequence - by n=100000 the maximum value is 8.
If n is in A014574 then a(n) = 2. - _Robert Israel_, Aug 05 2014
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
example: a(11)=3 because (11-1)*(11+1)=10*12=2^3*3*5, which has 3 distinct prime factors, namely 2,3 and 5.
results.author: _Jon Perry_, May 24 2003
